project.name: JMeter Templating Util
project.description:
Creates a jar that can be added to the JMeter /lib directory to add Velocity templates functionality to JMeter.
To use in a HTTP Sampler, add the following to the body of a HTTP Sampler Request: ${__BeanShell(gov.usgs.cida.jmetertemplate.Template.run("relOrAbsTemplatePathToTemplate.vm"\, ctx\, log))}
Escaping the commas is REQUIRED. The first argument is the path/name to the Apache Velocity template. If a relative path, it is relative to the .jmx file being run.
The second argument should be 'ctx' (no quotes). This is a JMeter supplied variable that is the current Context. It includes all the current variables, user parameters and system settings.
The third argument should be 'log' (no quotes). This is a JMeter supplied variable with the current logging object.
The template will then have access to all the current variables, thus, you can use the the template w/ access to variables just as you would in JMeter, eg: ${yourVarName}. However, you will have the added ability to use the control statements, loops and conditional logic provided by Velocity.
